Description: East Greek terracotta mould-made figure of naked man. White coating with red paint preserved on some areas of skin. Orange-brown fabric with abundant fine silver mica, quartz and rare white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The active pose and style of these joining fragments (NA450 joins NA338) are remeniscent of actors and dancers from Hellenistic Smyrna (Burn & Higgins 2001, nos 2386-7). See also NA337 from Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.374) (Phase 1)
